subject: Add Unit property to dbus interfaces
commitMessage:
Add Unit property to dbus interfaces

Previously, the lack of the Unit property on the Value interfaces
provided by dbus-sensors meant that readings from its sensors weren't
displayed in phosphor-webui/webui-vue.  Here it's added as an extra
parameter to setInitialProperties, allowing sensors that handle multiple
types of data (e.g. IpmbSensor, PSUSensor) to determine the appropriate
string to pass once they've had time to determine that.

Tested: PSUSensor, ADCSensor, CPUSensor, TachSensor, and HwmonTempSensor
all have an appropriate Unit property available on dbus, and are
displayed in webui-vue.

Signed-off-by: Zev Weiss <zev@bewilderbeest.net>
Change-Id: I5e6df74cc42d9fb84852c5bf3ea5d3b383a16cdc

Patch Set 4:

It's not a big deal (and having automated style checking still seems like a win overall), but in this particular case I have to say I think the mixed line-wrapping that it wanted for the unit string constants added in sensor.hpp (the delta between patchsets 2 and 3) is a bit counterproductive for overall readability.  Do we make occasional exceptions for that kind of thing or just stick to what the clang-format says?

Patch Set 4:

(4 comments)

Looking pretty darn close right off the bat.  Good work.  Just a couple minor things I'd like to see cleaned up, then this should be good to go.

If we're going to create a class like this, I'd prefer it holds more than just type and units (also, can't we look up units from type, or vice versa?)
Hadn't noticed the existence of sensor_paths::getPathForUnits(), so yeah, we can just do a lookup instead, no need for this.

I thought we already had this in an existing method somewhere that we had to build when we did external sensor.  I'd really prefer it live next to there so at least we keep all the unit things in one spot.

Found it, I realize it's not the best namespace, but lets put it here:

https://github.com/openbmc/dbus-sensors/blob/6cb732a31b7664089124b00e806311768bc24a87/src/SensorPaths.cpp#L12

This seems pretty clean.
